data.title: My favorite tacos!
data.text: I love this place and could eat here everyday! The staff is awesome and there is always a crowd (moves fast). Everything on the menu is amazing. They have daily specials so you can stay on budget. This is my pick for best Mexican downtown!

data.title: Skimpy  Taco  Salad
data.text: Four of us had take out. Everything was good, but the toco salad with ground beef had almost no meat. It was 95% rice, a little lettuce and peppers. I would guess less than a teaspoon of ground beef.  The tacos and sauces were generous and tasted great. I guess they just forgot the beef on the taco salad.

data.title: Awesome !
data.text:
We heard about this place while traveling on the way to Alabama and it did not disappoint !
I haven't had these kind of tacos since living in California! 
Love it !

data.title: Convenient and Delicious
data.text: We enjoyed two meals here during a quick trip to Nashville.  The location is convenient to many of the downtown hotels.  We ordered a lunch special which included rolled beef tacos and a bean tostada, everything was delicious.  We stopped back for breakfast and appreciated that the full menu was available, ordering a steak and a chicken burrito.  Loved their spicy salsas!

data.title: Quick tasty shredded favorites
data.text: Many of the items use the same topping but the shredded meats beats the ground beef.  Use the red sauce for the extra bam.  There are only four tables and a bar inside with a couple of tables curbside.  Many use takeout.  close weekday about 6 pm

data.title: Wonderful taco
data.text: Been there multiple times . Love the Quassidillas . Service is quick .Very reasonable priced . Best Mexican food in area easily !

data.title: Great Tacos
data.text: Stopped in here after visiting the Library. The tacos were great.  The tortillas are thin and crispy.  Delicious.

data.title: Lacked flavor
data.text: Got the beef taco lunch special. All the food tasted the same. Not much flavor. Beef in taco had a bad taste. Took one bite and couldn't eat the rest.

data.title: Great menu, large portions, tasty food
data.text: This was a restaurant that we had "scouted" before our trip to Nashville, and it was even better than what we hoped.  My wife had a chicken quesadilla, I had the California burrito, and my brother had a chimi.  They were all huge, and were very good.  The horchata was good, too.  I would definitely go here again... and again...  and again!

data.title: Tasty, Fresh, Cheap
data.text: I went to Oscar's for lunch twice in a 3 day period. I had various tacos and they were all great. The food is tasty, ingredients are fresh and it's all reasonably priced. They have a large selection of tacos, burritos, enchiladas, etc. It's exactly what you think it would be. The service was relatively fast.  The one day was quite busy with college students and  I still got my food pretty quick. Located downtown Nashville. Try it for a quick, cheap, good lunch.

data.title: Best tacos outside of Mexico!
data.text: Definitely make a point of coming here for lunch one day. The tacos are delicious and the queso is out of this world. Made for a perfect Taco Tuesday during a work conference. Tried the carnitas and the shrimp tacos and the shrimp one was my favourite.

data.title: good cheap mexican food
data.text: not very big but really good Mexican food usually full of locals so that says something they do breakfast all day  friendlt staff and fast service so even if there is a que its soon gone pretty central about 5/6 min of broadway

data.title: Tasty food, reasonable price!
data.text: This isn't a large restaurant, but there were lots of people there buying and enjoying the food. I had a Carnitas burrito and really enjoyed it.

data.title: Lunch Special A Good Value
data.text: We passed this place on a walking tour and made our way back to it later as what we saw people eating at their sidewalk tables looked good.  Beef Taco, Bean Tostada, 2 Rolled Tacos (really Taquitos) for $6.  Really fresh, good value.

data.title: Awesome  tacos
data.text: Great experience. Delicious and budget friendly. Small space but worth the wait staff very helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back.

data.title: Cheap, Fresh, Easy
data.text:
Title says it all. Slid into the shop for a quick lunch. Clean shop, cheap food and was made nice and quick even with 10 or so people in the shop!
Would go back definately!

data.title: Decidedly Forgettable
data.text: This place was close to my hotel, so I had lunch there hoping for some fresh, tasty Mexican.  Big line of what appeared to be mostly locals, so I was hopeful.  Unfortunately the food simply did not deliver.  I had the enchilada/burrito combo, and there was just nothing remarkable - not the meat, not the tortilla, not the sauce, nothing.  Very disappointing.

data.title: Tacos
data.text: Decent West Coast style soft tacos, but nothing special and not terribly fast. They have a wide variety of Mexican fare

data.title: Fun find! Worth the walk.
data.text: Very close to the Sheraton, this fun find had amazing food. I tried the shrimp tacos and they were fabulous!

data.title: Nah.  Average.
data.text:
Two colleagues joined me at Oscar's for lunch when we received a lunch break at the conference we were attending.  The place was packed for lunch and the service was quick considering the number of people...  

The beans and carne aside burritos were good but I didn't like my fish tacos.  The amount of fish on each taco was paltry and disappointing.  Several bites were just tortilla and pico de gallo and that was regrettable.  All and all, I would rate the experience average and I wouldn't return.  There are much better offerings for lunch in the vicinity.
